text: Anstruther Davidson (1860–1932) was a Scottish-American physician, professor of medicine, botanist, and entomologist. Born in Scotland, Davidson attended the University of Glasgow, where he graduated CM MB in 1881 and received his higher MD in 1887. He served a medical internship in the Glasgow Western Infirmary and then went into private practice at Thornhill, Dumfriesshire. After some time spent in Vienna, he emigrated in 1889 to the United States. He practiced medicine in Los Angeles and published papers in medical journals. He became an associate professor of dermatology at the University of Southern California, while simultaneously studying natural history and publishing papers on botany and entomology. In 1897 he married Alice Jane Merritt (1859–1931), author of California Plants in Their Homes: A Botanical Reader for Children (1898). ==Selected publications== * * * with George L. Moxley: ==Eponyms== * Acmispon nevadensis var. davidsonii (Greene) Brouillet * Malvastrum davidsonii B.L.Rob. ==References== Category:Botanists with author abbreviations Category:1860 births Category:1932 deaths Category:19th-century American botanists Category:20th-century American botanists Category:Alumni of the University of Glasgow Category:Keck School of Medicine of USC faculty
title: Anstruther Davidson
